Applies to

  • PCI DSS Requirement 4.1
  • PCI DSS Requirement 4.1.d

What to Do

Accepts only trusted SSL/TLS certificates, if SSL/TLS is being used.

Why

Using a trusted key or certificate prevents an attacker from posing as a trusted party or substituting the key to be able to decrypt the transmission.

How

Identify whether SSL/TLS is used. Identify all the certificates and keys used to encrypt the transmissions. Verify that all the used keys and certificates are authorized by examining the certificates and keys and interviewing the issuing parties. Add all the used keys and certificates to the trusted certificates or keys list of each respective application, such as a web browser.
